page.title: 18Religion in Ballantrae.
page.content: Apathy seems widespread.Believers are Christians,mainly Presbyterians.Roman Catholics and Episcopalians worship in Girvan.All denominations fraternise. The self-supporting Parish Church,now united with Glenapp,has 360 members. Worship,with hymns,psalms,prayers, readings,sermon is on Sundays at 11am. Around 60 attend,summoned by a bell. Male minister occupies large nearby manse.There are 18 elders(2 women)17 Congregational Board members(mainly women)woman organist,mixed choir of 12 Women's Guild and Sunday School with 4 women teaching 30 pupils,who leave for Community Centre after part of service Twice yearly Communion has individual glasses.Services are held on Christmas Eve and the World Day of Prayer.In Church are baptisms,some weddings and occasional funerals.Minister visits homes,local school and hospitals.
